intro: Stenanthemum cristatum, commonly known as the crested stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine, silvery or greyish pubescence. Stenanthemum cristatum is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions of southern and western Australia.
